pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:0.5: 20. The training rule on containing living beings
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Āḷavī at the Aggāḷava Shrine.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.2: At that time the monks at Āḷavī were doing building work. And they poured water that they knew contained living beings onto grass and clay, and they got others to do the same.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.3: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.4: “How can the monks at Āḷavī pour water that they know contains living beings onto grass and clay, and get others to do the same?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.5: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.6: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.9: “… Foolish men, how can you pour water that you know contains living beings onto grass and clay, and get others to do the same?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.10: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.11: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:1.12.1: ‘If a monk pours water that he knows contains living beings onto grass or clay, or has it poured, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.1.4: …The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.1.6: he knows by himself or others have told him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.1.10: if he asks another, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.1.11: If he only asks once, then even if the other pours a lot, he commits one offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.2.1: If it contains living beings, and he perceives that it does, and he pours it onto grass or clay, or he has it poured, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.2.2: If it contains living beings, but he is unsure of it, and he pours it onto grass or clay, or he has it poured, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.2.3: If it contains living beings, but he  perceives that it does not, and he pours it onto grass or clay, or he has it poured, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.2.4: If it does not contain living beings, but he perceives that it does, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.2.5: If it does not contain living beings, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.2.6: If it does not contain living beings, and he perceive that it does not, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.3.6: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.3.7: The tenth rule, the training rule on containing living beings, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc20:2.3.8: The second sub-chapter on plants is finished.
